com.sun.enterprise.module
Interface LifecyclePolicy

public interface LifecyclePolicy

Modules that wish to invoke special logic when it is loaded, started or stopped should implement this interface.

Author:
dochez

Method Summary
 boolean getService(java.lang.Object serviceContext)
          Requests a service offered by this module.
 void load(Module module)
          Callback when the module enters the RESOLVED state (all classloaders dependencies are resolved).
 void start(Module module)
          Callback when the module enters the READY state.
 void stop(Module module)
          Callback before the module starts being unloaded.
 

Method Detail

load

void load(Module module)
Callback when the module enters the RESOLVED state (all classloaders dependencies are resolved). Each submodule is guaranteed to be in at least RESOLVED state.

Parameters:
module - the module instance

start

void start(Module module)
Callback when the module enters the READY state. This is a good time to do any type of one time initialization or set up access to resources

Parameters:
module - the module instance

stop

void stop(Module module)
Callback before the module starts being unloaded. The runtime will free all the module resources and returned to a NEW state.

Parameters:
module - the module instance

getService

boolean getService(java.lang.Object serviceContext)
Requests a service offered by this module. The module's user can pass a context defining the requested service characteristics. A service initialization routine can also update the context to add accessors to get the service specific hooks.

Parameters:
serviceContext - the context information
Returns:
a flag with the service's initialization success
